website_summaries.verdict: Power users and gamers should look no further than the SanDisk Extreme Pro to get the best performance out of their home computer.
pros: The SanDisk Extreme Pro SSD has top performance and the longest warranty to date

customer_reviews.title: These have a high failure rate - keep good backups.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these for a Mac Pro system. Installed them on PCIe boards to get SATA III high throughput. In under 3 years all of them failed. I went through the RMA process and returned them and have received 3 new drives. This took about a month. That's a month I have been out of production. I will install the new drives today but I no longer trust them with critical data. Meanwhile my rust spinner backup RAID array has been spinning along for 5 years with no problems. I thought SSD's would be more reliable but this has not been the case.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Centrist

customer_reviews.title: SSD changed my life, and this is a good one
customer_reviews.text: For a long time, I resisted the temptation of getting an SSD because they were expensive as well as occasionally unreliable. Finally I decided to treat myself, and I can't believe it but it actually makes such a huge difference - mainly in game loading times and even when opening a file explorer. I've been using this for a few months now and it's been great. Of course, I do wish I had more SSD storage, but this has served me well holding my OS and games. This SanDisk is really fast and has given me no troubles that some of the older SSDs allegedly had a few years ago. The drive was easy to install and get running.
customer_reviews.author: Z.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for video production
customer_reviews.text: I use this to record video from my camera with an external recorder. I usually use, but I have used others. The SanDisk Extreme Pro is one of the recommended drives for the Atoms device. I've been in production for 16 years and this blows my mind. I shot an entire movie on the SSD, handed to the director and said "here's your movie". This is a fantastic workflow when dealing with clients and as far as the disk itself-- super fast and reliable. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Fast, large, well reviewed!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in an IBM Thinkpad T530. Works very well. For me, I took out the dvd tray, slapped in a hard drive caddy with this ssd, then used MiniTool Partition Wizard Free Edition 9.1. In their software it's an easy "migrate to new HD/SSD" button, hit apply, it reboots, and copies everything to the new drive. Then I replaced the hard drive with this ssd, put my dvd rom back in, and rebooted. With a desktop, just connect this to an empty SATA slot with the power cord, and run the same software. Windows 10 came back up without any issues. Easy and painless. Loving the additional speed and size. 10 year warranty gives me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Mac Pro (and the correct adapter!)
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great, plugged it into my Mac Pro with this adapter: I believe even the Mac 5,1 silver 2012 Mac Pros are only compatible with SATA II-3GB/s but this SATA III -6GB/s drive seems to be backward compatible. Note, a fresh OS install (no apps) will generally take up about 30GB, so the 240GB 3GB/s version could work just fine, leaving room for apps to cache files to "disk". I got a deal from Amazon Warehouse used-like new so I'm happy anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mikes Shoppin’ Reviews

customer_reviews.title: I've been extremely pleased with this SSD.  Consistently fast.
customer_reviews.text: I felt burned by Samsung and their 840 EVO SSD. Latest "fix" requires machine to be always on to make sure data is moved around -- to prevent read slowdown. And the slowdown isn't from 1 week old "stale" data -- so I don't know how review websites can rate the fix. In fact, the review sites were wrong the first time Samsung released a fix -- hence Samsung came out with yet another fix. Samsung does not want to support or provide a path to 840 PRO or 850 EVO/PRO line ... even if you are willing to pay the difference. I've been extremely pleased with this SSD. Consistently fast.
customer_reviews.author: g00ber

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding upgrade for an older PC
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast SSD. I wanted to use it as the sole drive in an older PC (with an ASUS model P7P55D PRO motherboard), but was reluctant to connect the drive via the relatively slow SATA II interface on this motherboard. Instead, I mounted the drive on an OWC Accelsior S (PCI to SATA Drive Mount card; see product link:), which provides an extremely fast SATA interface. The combination worked flawlessly the first time. I'm amazed at how much faster my PC boots up & runs now. It's really like getting a new computer, and this has greatly extended the useful life of my 5-year old PC. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J (not the famous one)

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Lives up to it's performance reviews. Ten year warranty.
customer_reviews.text: SSD has been running flawlessly for 8+ months. Remember to register your drives with SanDisk (SSD product code = serial number) ASAP.  Suggest you download the current free SanDisk SSD Dashboard tool. I had some issues with it grabbing the display focus from full screen apps but solved it by exiting the tool and turning off the "Start SSD Dashboard with WIndows Startup settings option.
customer_reviews.author: AbsoluteJoe

customer_reviews.title: The sandisk extreme pro works fantastic in this system
customer_reviews.text: I built my gaming pc using the extreme pro 480gb as my main internal drive. Build: Gigabyte z170x gaming 7, i7 6700 cpu, geforce 980 gpu, corsair vengeance 16gb pair of ram, windows 10, azza 1000 r tower, cooler master geminII cpu fan,ect. The sandisk extreme pro works fantastic in this system. Everything I do is very quick and after hours of use the temps are low and fans never kick up to high speed. The boot up time is nearly instant.
customer_reviews.author: 74lewey

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast SSD with a 10 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: Blazing fast and easy to install. This took away my last excuse for not regularly backing up my data. It's so speedy that it takes only minutes to create an image and store it on another SSD. The 10 year warranty clenched the deal for me. I doubt I'll be using this same drive a decade from now, but knowing the manufacturer has faith it'll last that long gives me confidence my data will be safe. This is one of the best purchases I've made in a long time. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Call_Them_As_I_See_Them

customer_reviews.title: Good product BUT lacking documentation and installation support
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars IF there was decent support on website or included with SSD. Tried to install (clone) on Win10 laptop using the Sandisk Installation "kit". It doesn't work so save your money!! I ended up downloading a trial/demo copy of Paragon Backup and Recovery 15. It worked perfectly. It worked so well I purchased a copy from them. Once installed the Sandisk Extreme Pro works EXTREMELY well. Good product BUT lacking documentation and installation support.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip S. Hills

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new laptop and installed this drive. It's very fast- rebooting takes only seconds and I can quickly access any file on my system. Furthermore, transferring photos from a camera is much faster, particularly via USB 3.0. So far this drive has done everything I've asked of it and has met my expectations in every way. While I have not pushed it's durability (e.g. dropped the computer, etc.) I suspect it is much more resistant to damage than a traditional mechanical drive. I would recommend it to anyone looking to upgrade their system's storage.
customer_reviews.author: William Stanney

customer_reviews.title: The Speed I Need
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to replace the 5400 rpm drive that came with my laptop which was now slowing down to about a whole minute to allow me to start using the computer at start up. At the time it was a bit more expensive but I believed in the brand, quality, and its reviews. It has vastly sped up my system and it still is ready to use in under about 20 seconds from restart. I might look into getting another Sandisk drive with larger storage since my computer has taken on about 100 gigs of homework software projects and games over the past few semesters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: Sure its pretty fast and quite costly, but I'm very disappointed that my Sandisk SSD is dead in 3 years. Comparatively my Samsung EVO SSD's are all 5 years old and still going strong. So yeah, I guess I won't be buying Sandisk SSD's again.
customer_reviews.author: Substance

customer_reviews.title: Amazing difference in computer speed when you add an SSD
customer_reviews.text: Being my first SSD I have no complaints. Boot time for my windows 10 5 year old computer is about 50-52 seconds.Amazing difference in computer speed when you add an SSD. By adding an SSD you also lose the spinning sound of a traditional HDD which makes your computer much quieter. Adding an SSD to an older computer can be challenging and I had to do some research but it was worth every penny. Don't forget to download Sandisk SSD dashboard from their website after installing as it is a useful utility.
customer_reviews.author: B. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: This SSD replaces my C:\drive and is smoking fast in comparison. Although my motherboard is only a SATA II, I have an add-on card with USB 3.0 and two SATA III connections. I am now spoiled. Adobe Photoshop used to take nearly a minute to load and now loads in 10 seconds. PC Tuneup Utilities works extremely fast now. I look forward to updating all of my PC based on this great product. I highly recommend this SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Roger J.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I've always stuck with SanDisk drives, whether SD cards ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always stuck with SanDisk drives, whether SD cards or SSDs. After buying smaller SSDs to do a duel drive setup, one for the OS and a HDD for the files, only to find that I needed more space for more programs I finally bit the bullet and got one large SSD for everything. Totally worth it. My computer flies. I'm not much of a gamer and mainly use my computer for leisure and photography. My computer boots up really quick, mere seconds, and Lightroom and Photoshop run smoothly and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Zak

customer_reviews.title: Paid for the quality and warranty
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the speed and capacity, but I'm having second thoughts regarding the price and what you get when compared to similar drives. Granted, I got it mostly because of the warranty and a hopefully better product to trust my data on, so that's what I was actually putting my money, not really on performance. Using it as a boot/home drive in a desktop with Linux and btrfs, there is no noticeable day-to-day difference when compared with a drive from the budget or OEM/enterprise series of SanDisk.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: O M G AMAZING DIFFERENCE!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow this is a game changer. Not only was it quick and easy to install (and I'm no technical magician either) but the results far exceed my expectations. Toshiba Satellite Radius P55W laptop with dual-core i7 Intel processor and 8 GB of RAM now boots up in under a minute and apps launch instantly. My laptop (1 year old at the time of this writing) is good but is known for its slow mechanical hard drive. I am still in disbelief. No issues with the cloning process. I closed the case, screwed on the cover, booted up the machine and the speed boost was instant with zero glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 960 GB and replaced an old 5400 RPM HDD is my laptop. Hands down the best upgrade I could have made. Very fast transfer rates and incredibly fast boot and launch times. I am incredibly pleased with my purchase! Warranty is amazing. Cost is a downside; however, this drive is priced exceptionally well relatively speaking.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect in my Atomos Ninja Blade
customer_reviews.text: I use a few of these with myand couldn't be happier. The video from my DSLR is uncompressed and this drive allows me to shoot for hours without switching drives. It is high quality, and fast. Plus, you don't have to worry about motion or jostling ruining a shot they way you would with a HDD in the Blade.
customer_reviews.author: Drew2211Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worthy Upgrade! Performance index went from 5.7 to 7.9 (8=Max) :0)
customer_reviews.text: Worked Great! Upgraded my HP Elite 8300, used the free MiniTool Partition Wizard available here on Amazon, first connected the SSD on the system so the W7 OS would recognize the drive and install the driver it needed, then just used the MiniTool Partition Wizard to copy the contents of my regular Boot drive to the SSD, then unplugged the old physical drive and booted to the SSD, no problems. My PC now boots faster and I don’t constantly hear the hard drive seek/write all the time, performance index on the drive went from 5.7 to 7.9 (8=Max) :0)
customer_reviews.author: Fixitguy

customer_reviews.title: Super performance and top-quality.  Can't recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.text: SanDisk has always had a reputation for quality products and this SSD is no exception. With the cost of SSD drives falling it is not hard to justify an upgrade if you are still using mechanical hard drives. This is a great price for a large capacity drive like this. I still use a mechanical drive for bulk storage, but all my programs run from this one, and you won't believe the difference in the response of your computer when you upgrade to a SSD. I have no problem recommending this drive, it is top-quality all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast, cut my reboot speed by 50%. ...
customer_reviews.text: Blazing fast, cut my reboot speed by 50%. NOTE: This is a bare SSD only, without screws, cables, brackets, or cloning cable & software. I also picked up the following: 1) "AFUNTA 6-Inch Sata Power Y Splitter Cable Adapter - M/f (Power Cable)" to provide power, from Amazon 2) APRICORN "Notebook Drive Upgrade Kit" (cloning cable & software) from Best Buy 3) A standard "2.5 to 3.5 ssd adapter" from my local computer store. Of these three additional items I had the hardest time finding the power-Y splitter. Couldn't find it in any local computer store.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: A great optimization!
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely incredible upgrade. My initial benchmarks indicate boot time at 20% of the original time, maybe lower. Database programs and processes run a lot faster when using the disk for a database. Even browsing and video is greatly sped up, as the time to load cached images and video content is very fast, so it even appears to improve the quality of the displayed video. I guess with the old green hard drives, the time the browser program takes to load the data is enough time to reduce image quality. An absolute must for any personal or computationally intensive business computer. Certainly good for servers too.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer786

customer_reviews.title: This Product Couldn't be Easier to Install.
customer_reviews.text: This would have cost me $699 anywhere else. I got it for a steal. It was simple to clone my old HDD and install this product without any glitches whatsoever. My computer now has all the speed and memory I could wish for. I plan to use this drive for a very long time. For those wondering, this is a 7mm drive with the SATA III connector. It comes with a piece you can attach in case you need it to fit a deeper 9mm slot, which I didn't. I spent the extra $$ to have it shipped overnight (1 day shipping). I got it the next afternoon, as promised, without any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Friend

customer_reviews.title: Nearly a terabyte for a good price
customer_reviews.text: To review the SSD itself, I've had zero issues, its small, easy to mount, easy to install. To review the impact of having an SSD, It shortened my 2 minute boot times to around 3 seconds, I load into games insanely quick, and the SSD runs dead silent, unlike my previous HDD that was begging me for death.
customer_reviews.author: Patryk Podmokly

customer_reviews.title: Drop-in Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This was a drop-in replacement for a laptop hard-drive. Easy to port over the operating system and this unit runs faster and uses less power, extending the battery life of a dated laptop.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Its a good solid state drive.
customer_reviews.text: I had to add a third solid state since I had filled up the 500gb model I had with games and my main drive is only for windows. Its fast with a small footprint compared to the standard hard drives I used to use which is true of almost all solid states. Having a third drive did slow my boot time slightly but only enough to barely notice, compared to other computers it is a fast boot up. Its a good solid state drive and am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: first time using this; before I was using their ultra2 cheaper units. biggest diff: the pro clocks in at about 550mb/sec for BOTH read and write! on the ultra2 its 500 or so on read but 350 or so on write. I will buy the pro, from now on. also, I avoid s*sung evo stuff and even their pro stuff, so this was one of my only choices for high end consumer grade ssd
customer_reviews.author: linux-works

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing, took my mid 2011 iMac running Mavericks from a boot time of over a minute to under 10 seconds with absolutely no lag. I cannot recommend it enough - the "pro" class is definitely the way to go with an SSD and the 10 year warranty is just the icing on the cake. It makes my old iMac feel like a totally different and new machine. With it more than 1/2 full (190 GB FREE), it still is clocking in at 380-410 MB/s read and write - definitely work the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark 006.5

customer_reviews.title: New life to lagging laptop
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old spinning drive in laptop, and now it runs like new and better!! It's been over a year with this SSD, and the laptop so continues to purr along with lickety quick response. Was very easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: TODD G LINDBERG

customer_reviews.title: MLC!
customer_reviews.text: Samsung Pro has double the endurance specification (marketing?) and half the warranty for their Pro TLC drives. Most enterprise drives use MLC memory so I came to the conclusion that it is better. I pick this up on Amazon Warehouse deals. Had one terabyte written in its previous life. Dash board shows the wear out to be 0.26%. Still has the 10 year warranty when I went to register the drive. Well worth it for an additional fifty dollar savings at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Clandestine

customer_reviews.title: Love this drive.
customer_reviews.text: I've got three of these babies in my desktop dedicated for gaming and I love 'em. And with the price drop, why are you waiting? Sure, there's some next gen stuff coming out soon, but so what? Do you have a NASA rig that will be able to tell the difference? Oh, DO NOT buy the EVO line! Only Extreme PRO. Take my advice on this.
customer_reviews.author: The Artist

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a 10 yr warranty
customer_reviews.text: This was my first SSD. I was torn between this and a Samsung EVO. Really, it was the 10 yr warranty that swung me to the SanDisk. Since longevity it still a concern with SSD, I don't regret spending a little more for the piece of mind. It worked flawlessly on initial fire up. It's my OS drive and I had zero issues installing Windows 8.1 on my brand new gaming rig I just built. Holy crap does this thing boot up fast! The main specs of my PC: ASUS Maximus Hero VII Intel 4790K PNY GTX 770 OC 4GB 16 GB ADATA 2400 WD 1TB HDD
customer_reviews.author: Dane S.

customer_reviews.title: fast, quiet, probably reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Instant response to file loading, startup and most computer activities. Very happy with this purchase so far. Do your research though- you may already know that there are 'industrial quality' and 'consumer quality' drives, the latter being less expensive and the former being a better business investment... Samsung and a very few other companies make the chips and software inside and they frequently come up with breakthrough improvements in price, speed and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: swell

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and was easy to install. Used the clone program referenced by another purchaser - Macrium. Very fast at sata3 and still fast at sata2 (180 MBs on old pc). Programs and files load almost instantly and should make the old desktop pc useable for the next couple of years. The old 500gb drive is used for DATA and the new C-Drive is used for the operating system and programs. I did not want to remove the DVD drive so I just put it in the same mount. It fit perfectly between the DVD drive and the cage around it.
customer_reviews.author: K Guillory

customer_reviews.title: My laptop has been transformed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this SSD to replace the HDD that came with my laptop. Using the free utilities to transfer all of the data from the computer was really quite easy and only took about 30 minutes (you'll need to buy a USB 3.0 SATA III hard drive adaptor cable if you don't already have one). Once the data was transferred I was able to install the drive and it booted right up. Performance for my laptop has improved dramatically. After running benchmark tests between the HDD and SSD, the SSD read and write speeds are over 6 times faster than the HDD. The machine itself runs noticeably faster, quieter, cooler, and the battery life is much longer as well.
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for my T410 Lenovo 500GB HDD.
customer_reviews.text: I cant be happier more... This drive and the Sandisk Software ((SDSSDCK-AAA-G27)) that I purchased to clone my existing drive are excellent. I was little anxious if this drive would work on my aging T410 Lenovo. However everything worked like a charm. The software was easy to install and manage. In just couple of hours my exiting 500GB HDD was cloned to this 480G SSD. I am facing a challenge to register the device to the Sandisk support, but that is a side issue.
customer_reviews.author: F. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Like all SSD's this drive makes no sound at all ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this as my C-drive on a new Levono I7 PC with 16MB RAM. I took out the original HDD with Windows 8 installed and put my own copy of Win 7 OS on this SSD along with my programs. My computer is SILENT and SO FAST!!! Like all SSD's this drive makes no sound at all (no moving parts) and requires no fan cooling. The only trouble I had was adapting its tiny size to the 3.5" bay in my tower PC, which is a mechanical problem. I love this drive!!!
customer_reviews.author: hereandnow

customer_reviews.title: Blazing Fast!
customer_reviews.text: This SSD easily saturates my SATA II 3Gbps port by delivering over 250 MB/s seq. read/write and over 60MB/S 4K random access. My 5-year-old windows 7 pro, taking minutes to boot previously, now kicks in within 30 secs! However, full potential of this drive could only be fulfilled by 32nm or 22nm fab. chipsets, which incorporate innate SATA III 6Gbps support.
customer_reviews.author: TP_FAN

customer_reviews.title: I installed this on my Dell E5450 Latitude notebook. ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Dell E5450 Latitude notebook. Installed my primary OS and son of a gun, the computer boots up very fast. This is my first attempt into SSD and so far I am cautiously optimistic about it. Price was also reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Welser

customer_reviews.title: I can not brag that I know alot about this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am still using this hard-drive after 6yrs. It is out-dated by now. I believe the laptop may collapse before this hard-drive burns out. FYI- they exceeded the typical statis-quo on this one with a 10yr warranty
customer_reviews.author: Stegmon Weirdt

customer_reviews.title: This has been a fantastic investment. I first installed it on a Dell ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a fantastic investment. I first installed it on a Dell workstation running Windows 7 in April of 2015 for data storage only. At that time it replaced a WD VelociRapter and dramatically improved my perception of computer "speed". This year, I bought an Asus system and moved the SanDisk to it with no disruption and no problems with my data. After 20 months it's still at 100% in the SanDisk SSD Dashboard.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Ponder

customer_reviews.title: This second one works just fine and I was able to register it online without ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent the first one back since it constantly hung my machine. Also could not register the first one since the serial number was invalid (could this have been a counterfeit?). This second one works just fine and I was able to register it online without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Toot

customer_reviews.title: Very good performance.
customer_reviews.text: Very good performance. I am pleased with this SSD. I believe it is faster in read and write times than my plextor M.2SSD drive that it replaced on my Asus X99-Deluxe, due to running out of space. I have not bench-marked it yet so i cannot verify its true speeds. I chose not to use the free software offer included with the SSD to clone my plextor SSD hard drive to this new one. I am very, very happy so far. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: almost 2 years to the date of purchase this drive failed. Its my C drive in my laptop. Not sure if I will be able to get anything off it. 2 years in a laptop that never leaves the docking station is really poor.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Butler

customer_reviews.title: This product is AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: Words cant describe how happy I am with this product!!! I have a 2010 HP EliteBook 8540P. This SSD replace my original HDD. OH MY GOD, what a difference! It is night and day. My computer starts up, shuts down, loads programs, etc, SO MUCH FASTER with this SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Codey Carns

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Before I had an older samsung 1TB drive but it never felt this snappy and it ended up going with my old machine to family. My new machine is running this which is about a year old now but still its fast and reliable to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan C Haney

customer_reviews.title: Very good drive for the money
customer_reviews.text: I picked this SSD to upgrade my 2 year old Dell Latitude E5540. Once I had my original drive cloned to this one and installed, the machine was smokin fast. I went from almost 90 second boot time to less than 30 second boot time. I also noticed a vast difference in temperature of the laptop. Before the fans would run almost all the time. Now they hardly ever run. Very good drive for the money.
customer_reviews.author: mjonesjr

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solid state drive. Got one of these for one of my PCs because of SanDisk's reputation, low price, and excellent performance. I have a Samsung 850 Pro SSD in another PC - and it is reputed to be the fastest consumer SSD you can buy, but have to admit, the SanDisk drive is just as fast as the Samsung, and much cheaper! Can't beat this kind of performance for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ron S. Cullen

customer_reviews.title: The warranty service is kind of poor though. Sandisk keeps rejecting my S/N saying it ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding SSD for gamers and for everyday use. My boot up time was significantly reduced and my read/write speeds are substantially quicker after having replaced my SSD hybrid. The warranty service is kind of poor though. Sandisk keeps rejecting my S/N saying it is invalid for this product. Otherwise, outstanding drive.
customer_reviews.author: Schraufabagel

customer_reviews.title: hummmm
customer_reviews.text: was expecting much faster times from this on my 2008 mac but its not that huge an improvement. i think i could have gotten the same results from the cheaper version (extreme 2) from sandisk. It opens some things fast and others seem to hang: example - adobe reader sometimes takes forever to open a pdf after this install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. Worth the price because of the MLC nand, Marvel chip and 10-year warranty !
customer_reviews.text: Up until now I have found no issues. I used some disk-checking software and AS SSD Benchmark to test this drive. The result is quite good. But as we all know, the performance is not so important. As a data storage device the stability, reliance and durability are most important. As far as I know, this SSD uses MLC nand and Marvell controller chip and has an unbeatable 10-year warranty, which can resolve all my worries. That is why I choose Extreme Pro Series. That is why it is worth 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Been using in my primary computer for about 4 months now, works great so far. The real test is to see how long it will last before failing. A previous model lasted about 5 years. I'm hoping this one will last 10+ years and if not, I can get it replaced under the amazing 10 year warranty! Only complaint I have is have to register to activate the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I bought this SSD as it's recommended by Blackmagic for the Production Camera 4K and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD as it's recommended by Blackmagic for the Production Camera 4K and I haven't been disappointed. Fast, stable and high capacity, specially for working with large files like Cinema DNG and Raw. In some cases formatting the disk is required before using; otherwise your equipment might not recognize it. But it works fine and it is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Claudinho Andres

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Installation went smoothly with Acronis Data Software (not included). Cloned boot drive (windows 7 pro) on a multi drive workstation. Remember to remove some program "activations" before disc cloning!! Enabled AHCI mode in Windows 7 pro. Reboot. Enable AHCI vs IDE/SATA mode in Bios on MB. Reboot. Excellent performance so far.
customer_reviews.author: Unanimouse

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk is my goto for SSD's, they've never given ...
customer_reviews.text: Sandisk is my goto for SSD's, they've never given me problems. Let me be clear: i've not done any comparison. Yet, I've had nothing but positive experiences with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very happy and plan to buy more for other machines in ...
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly with my Gigabyte GA-Z97X 3 motherboard. Very quick load times (comparable to my old Samsung Pro 850 drive. I used Marcium Reflect to clone my existing spindle-based HDD to the SanDisk. So I cannot attest to the SanDisk cloning software that you can download from their website. For the price, this SSD is really a no brainer. I'm very, very happy and plan to buy more for other machines in my office.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bottom Tooth

customer_reviews.title: Really fast, 10 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: These are really fast and the 10 year warranty is longer than most. It comes with a shim to fit some laptops that expect a thicker fit. It comes with a coupon to download a free monitoring software. The storage sizes seem to be a bit smaller than other brands, why is that?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Challis

customer_reviews.title: They had switch to SanDisk Extreme PRO SSD drive and really like them. Switch out the one I had at ...
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my Samsun SSD drive at home, so I talked to our IT guys at work and they were having the same problems with Samsun drive. They had switch to SanDisk Extreme PRO SSD drive and really like them. Switch out the one I had at home and now everything is working fine for the last 3 months. Bob
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: SSD instead of new computer
customer_reviews.text: This speeded up my 4 year old desktop enough that I have stopped looking for a replacement computer. I use it as my boot drive and for all the Windows and program files. And the good news is, when I finally do get a new computer, I can move this SSD to there and get even better results. (Note that my computer is old enough that it only supports SATA-2, which limits my retrieval speed to only 3.0Gb/s. You need a computer that supports SATA-3 to get the full 6.0Gb/s.)
customer_reviews.author: C-Esq

customer_reviews.title: they are not quick as I'd like them to be
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, startup and shutdown times were lightning fast. About 6 months in, they are not quick as I'd like them to be. In all fairness, I probably need to clean up my computer. Wait for it to go on sale as these SSDs are getting cheaper all the time. This was a solid replacement for my Samsung Evo 840 as it gets better read/write speeds and double the capacity for around the same price.
customer_reviews.author: jordan lastnik

customer_reviews.title: MacBook Pro 2012 non retina. OSX compatible.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a great buy. It totally reinvigorated my MacBook pro which now runs faster than my faster than my girlfriends MacBook Air which is a whole model year newer. Migrating all my data from the old drive was easy with tutorials I found online. I've had this for 6 months now and it's been far more durable than my old spinning disk MacBook hard drive. Also, for what it's worth this is a best buy on Toms hardware, which is the place to look for hardware recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So so good. Has decreased my boot time
customer_reviews.text: So so good. Has decreased my boot time, maybe 80%. Programs load faster, seem to run better. Miss the constant noise of the hard disk, and at times I still have to check to see if my computer is still running. I am currently playing with ram disk, and I have yet to able to tell if my computer run's faster with or without ram disk. Overall feel like this purchase might have been a good investment. I bought this disk because of the ten year warranty, putting out almost $500.00, for a new toy, the warranty gives me a feeling of security. Right now, I would buy this toy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: and loading programs is super fast. I only have windows installed on this ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, only installed one so far, but it is blazing fast. I went from a 7200 RPM 500 Gig hard drive to this sucker. Boot time is fast, and loading programs is super fast. I only have windows installed on this SSD, with a few games that i play on a regular basis. So much quicker response times i love it !
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good step up. Recommend for novice or pro.
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the disk fast, but the monitoring software installed on Win 7 Pro easily. One program monitors both my SSD drives. This is my second SanDisk drive for my laptop, replacing a Western digital drive that had become full. Read up on formatting drives to Windows - that was the only part that SanDisk could document better. Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Techno Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drive
customer_reviews.text: Juat grabbed a second one of these because the first one worked out well. I had an issue registering for the ten year warranty and customer service was able to sort me out. Fast drive, ten year warranty... I had to get two!
customer_reviews.author: rhino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD
customer_reviews.text: To get the best performance to 530MB/s seq read, you'll need to install in main slot of your machine, with high speed SATA3 6.0Gb/s port Otherwise the transmission speed will be limited by SATA2 of your optical disc drive slot. Anyway good SSD in medium level with SanDisk's own 64Gbit 19nm MLC cell, old Marvell 9187 but more stable, and cheaper than 850 pro. if you have more money you can choose Intel 730, or PCIe for desktop. I'll give a s*** to sumsung's so-called 3D V-nand, you know reason. Avg. random write 65-95MB/s, enough for Win10
customer_reviews.author: withnt

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade I ever did to my custom built PC
customer_reviews.text: Best upgrade I ever did to my custom built PC. Putting your windows and other main programs on a SSD GREATLY increases your speed. Just do not use it for photo storage or other types of storage that will be added and erased frequently. I still use a standard hard disc for that.
customer_reviews.author: bryanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: ) speed is really good. 2
customer_reviews.text: 1.) speed is really good. 2.) can use the one time free cloning software(third Party) to clone the existing HDD to SSD. the cloning software can be downloaded (SSD DashBoard, from sandisk.com, cloning software is thridparty). 3.) You need SATA to USB adapter cable (need to buy separately, if you don't have one) ..
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: So fast!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent read/write speeds. Very reliable. Been using it non-stop for several months and haven't had any issues. When I tried to set up ready-boost with a USB 3.0 thumb drive on Windows 7 Ultimate, I received a message stating that this hard drive is so fast, ready boost would actually slow the system down. No noise, no moving parts. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: JBoi

customer_reviews.title: If you are thinking about doing this, just do it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I finally did this to my laptop. Now it runs a lot faster with programs opening in the blink of an eye. I had to install in place of my DVD drive by using a separate adapter since my laptop only had one drive slot. Now I have a fast main drive and a full TB hard-drive in the machine. Very nice indeed!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Aylward

customer_reviews.title: It is super fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the performance with the disk. It is super fast and reliable. The only issue is that it has only 890Gb of disk space. It is very odd - as my other Samsung SSD 1Tb disks and HDD 1Tb have 930Gb. Lost of 40Gb of disk drive is not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Hoa Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable how fast this is! Boots up my Windows 10 desktop in less than 10 seconds! YES...that Fast! Loads programs faster than your eyes can notice! Just Unbelievable and what a buy! Update 4/24/15 BEST investment I ever made! After 5 months; this baby still flies! Tried Samsung EVO 850 in another desktop...not happy with Samsung; a lot slower than this SanDisk Extreme Pro SSD!
customer_reviews.author: The Digital Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Got it ahead of scheduled delivery date, and makes the 3 year old laptop zoom. NOTE: does *not* come with cables or software to clone your disk, so be prepared to spend some time (and pay some money, if you are cloning a laptop drive that's larger than the SSD) getting it ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: A month old and is running great
customer_reviews.text: Put this in an older HP laptop and seems to be working well. This is the first SSD I've used, so I can't comment on comparing it to other models or brands. Did a fresh install of Windows 7 Pro so can't really tell you how easy it would be for replacing/cloning your old OS. I CAN tell you the Windows Experience Score for the hard drive went from 4.5 to 7.6 after installing the drive, so it did increase performance. Just wish my laptop supported SATA 6 then this drive would probably run at full potential.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic SSD!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent high capacity and exceptionally fast SSD!!! I used this drive as a replacement for a smaller and slower SSD primary C: system drive on my system. The increased speed in read/write times I observe with this drive is awesome. I also appreciate the commitment to quality by SanDisk with their exceptional 10 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I thought it would be...and more!
customer_reviews.text: Order arrived on time and in good condition. No issues cloning system drive to this SSD. By far one of the fastest Hard drives I have ever used. Windows boots in under 8 seconds, programs respond instantly, and the best part (being a gamer) almost zero load times in game. Over all I am very satisfied with this product and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to improve system response, or just breath some new life into an older rig.
customer_reviews.author: D. Prince

customer_reviews.title: SSD is best upgrade I've ever done
customer_reviews.text: quick as I expected. not much to say. SSD is best upgrade I've ever done. This is my 4th, this as quick as my crucials. maybe faster... I never benchmarked but feels similar. 480 is a much nicer living space than 128 or 256 I've done before. Go ahead Buy it, you know you want to.
customer_reviews.author: RitterF

customer_reviews.title: Hard Drive to SSD
customer_reviews.text: Replaced harddrive in a late 2008 Macbook Pro, after first cloning hard drive via a cable to the Scan Disk SSD. Works perfectly, loads fast, doubled storage space. Cheaper than buying a new computer. Only problem was removing screw of bracket holding hard drive in place. Head of little screw popped off, but then bracket just lifted off, unplugged old drive, plugged in SSD, placed bracket in place over remaining screw shaft, and everthing works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada

customer_reviews.title: Out with the old in with the new.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a cramp and aging (much more expensive at the time) OCZ Vertex 3 128GB on my personal rig. Although it isn't a move from conventional hard disk to SSD but I can clearly see the difference for my day to day computing and the occasional gaming. Boot up is clearly faster and smoother. I don't ever bother with benchmarks anymore as most good stuff are pretty well reviewed and I caught this at a bargain price. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Ong Chueng L

customer_reviews.title: What loading times...
customer_reviews.text: Fast. That is literally all I can is that it's fast. Yowza. Running W10 with an i5-6600k, 16gb ddr4 and this drive is the perfect compliment to those parts. Fast. Yowza. Game load times..what load times. Start up is sub 15 seconds. Price to size/speed is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: The performance is marginally better than my Samsung 840 Pro 256 GB
customer_reviews.text: It is a reliable SSD. The performance is marginally better than my Samsung 840 Pro 256 GB, Samsung 840 EVO 1TB, and Samsung 850 EVO 1TB. I cannot tell a real-world difference in that. At the time I purchased this, it was a good dollar-per-gigabyte ratio compared to similar Samsung models.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, It's super fast and fits perfectly in HP pavilion 15r touchscreen
customer_reviews.author: Fagro Vizcaino

customer_reviews.title: Great drives at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little drives - I replaced a large heavy HDD C: drive with this and my computer is much faster. I love the monitor program they supply with it. I bought a 240GB first and realized it was too small so bought the 480GB also. Kept the 240GB for auxillary storage.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Berr

customer_reviews.title: Very early impression: The silence is deafening.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 2010 15" MBP's original 500 GB hard drive with this, and the results are, so far, outstanding. I can actually login/logout and open programs quickly and none of the clicking / spinning / reading / writing of the old one. It was so quiet I couldn't believe the computer was working! Hopefully it was give me a few more good years from this machine, but time will tell. For the moment, though - the performance gain seems incredible. Can't believe I didn't do this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: tonyab

customer_reviews.title: maxed out Windows experience index
customer_reviews.text: I've had numerous solid state drives, including Intel SSD520, Intel SSD530, OCZ, ADATA, Samsung, Crucial. This is the first drive that gave me a 7.9 subscore (maximum score possible) on the Windows Experience Index. Guess that's why it's at the top of the leaderboard at storagereview dot com.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Jackson

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with Sandisk. Im using them ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Sandisk. Im using them for memory for 4K recording in the Ursa mini with C2 fast to Sata adaptor. No compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Fitty

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad SSD
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged and the units are very fast but do not make the speed spec as published - it falls a little short in the speed tests we have done but it does say 'up to' 550 and 515 and we are getting in the high 400's
customer_reviews.author: Michael Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Fast, fast, fast. A very quick & ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast, fast, fast. A very quick & simple upgrade that has made a bigger impact on PC speeds than any other upgrade (including processor, memory & video card upgrades). I bought a second drive for my laptop and the speed increase has been just as significant.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: One of the best upgrades you can do
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Hp Pavilion laptop dv7t 6c00 hard drive with this SSD. With an i7 and 16gb ddr3 and a fresh copy of Windows 7 the boot time was 10 seconds...13-18 seconds with all of the Hp software loaded. Completely silent and now my laptop runs a lot cooler too.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Borden

customer_reviews.title: Good Hard Drive...  Fast Performance With a Good Warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive to replace my hard drive on my Apple Mac mini Late 2009 computer. One of the reasons I chose this drive was because of its performance and warranty. A 10-year warranty had an influence in my purchase decision. After installing the drive, my computer boots up in under 10 seconds and my applications load 10 times faster. By using the apple built in Time Machine for back ups helped make the transition to my new drive very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ga

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this SSD for over a year and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this SSD for over a year and it's just as fast as it ever was. I get 550 read and 520 writes on Crystal Disk Mark all the time. You can run trim from the sandisk dashboard to keep it fresh. Keeps up with Samsung no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Manley

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wicked fast!
customer_reviews.text: Combined with the AMD Omega sata driver getting 560 read, 514 write in the ATTO benchmark. This is one of the fastest sata ssd's you can buy if you want something faster you will have to look into a PCI-E ssd. Highly Recommended. PS don't get caught up in the samsung hype, after i found out about their lawsuit against velocity micro, I won't be supporting them.
customer_reviews.author: d3adf1sh

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk vs. Samsung 850 Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook Pro model 8,2 late 2011 and I first tried the Samsung Pro 850. I ended up having to send that back, the random write was awful, VERY happy with this Sandisk! Great VALUE and PERFORMANCE. Out performing the Samsung in tests thus far which I thought was interesting.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD!
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable SSD so far, I've been using it for about 2 months right now. Very quick when reading and writing files to the drive. It also boots up very quick, I believe it's around less than 10 seconds I haven't ran a benchmark recently though. Installation of the SSD was really simple, all I had to do was slide it into my case's slot and plug in power and SATA cable.
customer_reviews.author: Mahdi H. Osman

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Affordable with Ample Storage
customer_reviews.text: I chose this drive after reading Tom's Hardware reviews for best performance for value SSDs. So far so good. I use it in a desktop setup, and Windows 8.1 boots so fast you barely have time to see the loading screen. Plus there is so much space on the drive that I don't have to be picky about what programs I install. I still have a 1TB HDD for long-term data storage, but its getting closer to the point where I might forgo HDD altogether if SDD storage keeps getting larger and more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Quartier

customer_reviews.title: I was nervous to convert to SSD, Now I am a believer. Too easy.
customer_reviews.text: I am not really techy but this was as easy as it gets. I purchased and used the Sandisk SSD conversion kit to clone my HDD. I removed my HDD from the system. I cannot believe the speed and improvement of my computer.If you are on the fence as I was go ahead and purchase this little gem. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I can go from power button to ready ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I can go from power button to ready to use in under 2 minutes now. My only complaint is that it doesn't come with any cables. In order to use it you will also have to purchase a 6 gbps SATA cable separate.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Slack

product_meta.title: SanDisk Extreme PRO 240GB SATA 6.0Gb/s 2.5-Inch 7mm Height Solid State Drive (SSD)
product_meta.description: Capacity:240GB| Style:Drive OnlySanDisk products are constructed to the good standards and rigorously tested. You can be confident in the good quality, performance and reliability of every SanDisk product.
feature_bullets: Innovative SanDisk nCachePro technology delivers sustainable high performance 24 x 7 x 365
Sequential Read Up To 550 MB/s; Write Up To 520 MB/s
TRIM support and Background Garbage Collection constantly free up unallocated blocks that once held data to lower latency and boost performance
SanDisk SSD Dashboard includes S.M.A.R.T. support to monitor the health of your SSD in real time to prevent data loss

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,872 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
